intro: Cipura rupicola, commonly known as the rock cipura, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, colorful flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
